title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2005.5 - Powers of presiding officers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2005.5 - Powers of presiding officers

State Regulations

Presiding officers are authorized to: (a) Administer oaths and
affirmations. (b) Sign and issue
subpoenas in the name of the corporation, requiring attendance and giving
testimony by witnesses and the production of books, papers and other
documentary evidence and said subpoenas shall be regulated by the Civil

Practice Law and Rules. (c) Provide
for the taking of testimony by deposition. (d) Regulate the course of the hearings, set
the time and place for continued hearings, and fix the time for filing of
briefs and other documents. (e) Direct the parties to appear and confer to consider the simplification of the
issues by consent of the parties. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2005.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
